message.content:
Certainly! Here's a seven-day meal plan that focuses on whole foods while adhering to your dietary restrictions. I've included breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks without using any dairy, milk-based yogurt, honey, garlic, or the specific nuts you mentioned. You can replace them with suitable alternatives or incorporate other nuts if you prefer.

**Day 1:**

- **Breakfast**: Overnight Oats (using unsweetened almond milk) - Combine rolled oats, chia seeds, unsweetened almond milk, and your choice of plant-based milk (such as soy or coconut). Add in sliced fruit like bananas, berries, or apples, and top with chopped nuts.
- **Lunch**: Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables - Cook quinoa and mix with roasted bell peppers, zucchini, and onions. Dress with lemon juice and olive oil, omitting honey.
- **Snack**: Apple slices with almond butter
- **Dinner**: Grilled Tofu and Vegetable Stir-Fry (use rice noodles instead of wheat or soy sauce) - Toss tofu with mixed veggies like broccoli, carrots, and mushrooms in a garlic-free stir-fry sauce made from low-sodium tamari or coconut aminos.

**Day 2:**

- **Breakfast**: Smoothie Bowl (using avocado as a creamy base) - Blend avocado, frozen mango, spinach, and unsweetened almond milk. Top with sliced strawberries, pumpkin seeds, and coconut.
- **Lunch**: Lentil Soup with Whole Grain Bread - Make a lentil soup using vegetable broth, without garlic, and serve with a slice of whole grain bread (e.g., rye or sourdough).
- **Snack**: Carrot sticks with pistachios
- **Dinner**: Baked Salmon with Roasted Asparagus (use lemon and herbs like parsley instead of honey)

**Day 3:**

- **Breakfast**: Avocado Toast on Gluten-Free Bread (use sunflower seed butter in place of almond butter)
- **Lunch**: Chickpea Salad Lettuce Wraps - Mix chickpeas with diced veggies, lemon juice, and a sprinkle of herbs. Use lettuce leaves as wraps instead of bread.
- **Snack**: Celery sticks with almond butter
- **Dinner**: Stuffed Bell Peppers (use cooked quinoa or rice mixture with black beans, corn, and spices)

**Day 4:**

- **Breakfast**: Greek Yogurt替代品 (use coconut yogurt or a nut-based alternative)
- **Lunch**: Kale and White Bean Soup (no garlic) - Cook kale, white beans, and vegetable broth in a pressure cooker.
- **Snack**: Roasted Edamame
- **Dinner**: Vegetable and Quinoa Stuffed Mushrooms

**Day 5:**

- **Breakfast**: Tofu Scramble with Spinach and Tomatoes - Use tofu instead of eggs and skip garlic.
- **Lunch**: Brown Rice Bowl with Shrimp (use coconut aminos for flavor) - Add cooked shrimp, steamed veggies, and a sprinkle of pistachios.
- **Snack**: Roasted pumpkin seeds
- **Dinner**: Baked Sweet Potato with Cilantro-Lime Greens and Black Beans

**Day 6:**

- **Breakfast**: Overnight Oats (using almond milk and topped with sliced almonds)
- **Lunch**: Zucchini Noodles with Tomato Sauce (use garlic-free tomato paste) - Spiralize zucchini and serve with a vegan sauce made from canned tomatoes.
- **Snack**: Roasted cashews
- **Dinner**: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms with Roasted Broccoli and Quinoa

**Day 7:**

- **Breakfast**: Chia Seed Pudding (unsweetened, no honey) - Mix chia seeds, unsweetened almond milk, and your choice of plant-based milk. Top with sliced fruit and nuts.
- **Lunch**: Falafel Wrap (use chickpea flour instead of wheat wrap) - Fill a wrap with falafel, lettuce, tomato, and cucumber.
- **Snack**: Sliced cucumbers with almond butter
- **Dinner**: Baked Tofu and Veggie Stir-Fry as a main dish (since it's low in carbs)

Remember to adjust portion sizes according to your needs and make sure to stay hydrated throughout the day. Feel free to mix and match ingredients or swap out any that don't appeal to you. Enjoy your healthy, nut-based meals!
